org.coniks.coniks_server

Class DirectoryOps

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.coniks.coniks_server.DirectoryOps

  • public class DirectoryOps
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements the high-level key directory-related operations performed by a CONIKS server.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DirectoryOps() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static UserLeafNode findUser(java.lang.String uname)
      Searches for the username uname in the current version of the key directory.
      static UserLeafNode findUserInEpoch(java.lang.String uname, long ep)
      Searches for the username uname in the key directory at epoch ep.
      static void mappingChange(java.lang.String uname, java.lang.String newKey, java.security.interfaces.DSAPublicKey ck, boolean allowsUnsignedChanges, boolean allowsPublicVisibility, byte[] msg, byte[] sig)
      Changes an existing name-to-key mapping in the key directory.
      static void register(java.lang.String uname, java.lang.String pk, java.security.interfaces.DSAPublicKey ck, boolean allowsUnsignedChanges, boolean allowsPublicVisibility)
      Registers a new name-to-key mapping in the key directory.
      static RootNode updateDirectory()
      Updates the key directory by handling all current pending registration and mapping change operations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DirectoryOps

        public DirectoryOps()

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public static void register(java.lang.String uname,
            java.lang.String pk,
            java.security.interfaces.DSAPublicKey ck,
            boolean allowsUnsignedChanges,
            boolean allowsPublicVisibility)
        Registers a new name-to-key mapping in the key directory. Adds this registration operation to the queue of pending operations, which are handled once per epoch.
        Parameters:
        uname - the username to register
        pk - the public key data to map to the registered name
        ck - the DSA public key used for key changes
        allowsUnsignedChanges - flag indicating the user's key change policy
        allowsPublicVisibility - flag indicating the user's key visibility policy

      • mappingChange

        public static void mappingChange(java.lang.String uname,
                 java.lang.String newKey,
                 java.security.interfaces.DSAPublicKey ck,
                 boolean allowsUnsignedChanges,
                 boolean allowsPublicVisibility,
                 byte[] msg,
                 byte[] sig)
        Changes an existing name-to-key mapping in the key directory. Adds this mapping change operation to the queue of pending operations, which are handled once per epoch.
        Parameters:
        uname - the username
        newKey - the new public key data to be mapped to the registered name
        ck - the DSA public key used for key changes
        allowsUnsignedChanges - flag indicating the user's key change policy
        allowsPublicVisibility - flag indicating the user's key visibility policy
        msg - the mapping change message required for signed changes
        sig - the signature on msg required for signed changes

      • findUser

        public static UserLeafNode findUser(java.lang.String uname)
        Searches for the username uname in the current version of the key directory.
        Returns:
        the user's entry in the directory or null if the name can't be found.

      • findUserInEpoch

        public static UserLeafNode findUserInEpoch(java.lang.String uname,
                           long ep)
        Searches for the username uname in the key directory at epoch ep.
        Returns:
        the user's entry in the directory or null if the name can't be found.

      • updateDirectory

        public static RootNode updateDirectory()
        Updates the key directory by handling all current pending registration and mapping change operations. This function is called at the beginning of the new epoch.
        Returns:
        the tree root for the updated directory, or null in case of an error.
